pull.title: qt: Improve TrafficGraphWidget functionality
pull.body:
This pull request brings substantial enhancements to the `TrafficGraphWidget`, making it far more useful, flexible, and user-friendly.

### Key Improvements:
1. **Enhanced visualization** – improved scaling (including logarithmic option) and new tooltips showing detailed traffic data on hover.
2. **Persistent traffic data** – traffic history is now preserved between sessions, eliminating the need to start from scratch each time.
3. **Flexible time ranges** – support added for smooth transitions between multiple sample ranges (from 5 minutes to 28 days).
4. **Improved time handling** – new utility functions provide better timestamp accuracy and millisecond precision.
5. **Qt6 compatibility** – deprecated Qt5 mouse event methods updated for modern Qt6 APIs.

### Why this matters:
Without these improvements, the `TrafficGraphWidget` loses all historical data every time the sample range is changed. This severely limits its usefulness in real-world usage, as most users are likely to stick to just one fixed time range to avoid losing data. This update solves that issue by persisting traffic data across time range changes, allowing users to freely zoom in for short-term analysis or zoom out to view long-term trends—**without data loss**.

Additionally, this version supports using the **left and right arrow keys** to switch seamlessly between time ranges, making navigation even easier.

I've included a video in the PR description showcasing the updated traffic graph in action, so you can see the improvements for yourself.

This PR is a rebased and significantly improved version of #559, targeting the latest `core/master`.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/775c9e12-3722-4d43-8eb5-a832589eb13d

qt: Add formatBytesps function for bytes per second display

Add a new GUI utility function to format bytes per second values with appropriate
units (B/s, kB/s, MB/s, GB/s) and precision, ensuring consistent and readable
display of network traffic rates in the traffic graph widget.

* A sanitizer issue, which can only be found by compiling with the sanitizer and running the

* An intermittent issue.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

net: Add setTotalBytes functionality for traffic data persistence

Add functions to set total bytes sent/received counts to enable restoring
traffic statistics between application sessions. This allows for continuous
traffic monitoring even after application restarts, improving the usefulness
of the traffic graph widget.

Add a new time formatting function that matches the existing date and datetime
ISO8601 formatting functions, providing consistent time display for the
traffic graph widget tooltips and other UI elements that need time-only display.

util: Add GetTimeMillis convenience wrapper for chrono timestamps

Add a convenience wrapper function for obtaining the current system time
in milliseconds. This uses the modern std::chrono library internally
while providing a shorter, more readable interface for code that needs
millisecond precision timestamps.

This improves code readability in areas like the TrafficGraphWidget that
work with millisecond timestamps while maintaining compatibility with
Bitcoin Core's move toward using std::chrono-based time handling.

tree 1031ae4f24e6d5883155dbfabbc571d97733f393
parent 9522c30b7fdc91133e8904e0cce5aef8530d6593
author R E Broadley <rebroad@users.noreply.github.com> 1743596478 +0100
committer R E Broadley <rebroad@users.noreply.github.com> 1744271545 +0100

qt: Enhance TrafficGraphWidget with multi-timeframe support and data persistence

This commit significantly improves the network traffic graph widget with:

1. Multiple timeframe support - View traffic data across different time
   periods (5 minutes to 28 days) using an enhanced slider interface

2. Traffic data persistence - Save and restore traffic information
   between sessions, preserving historical traffic patterns

3. Interactive visualization features:
   - Logarithmic scale toggle (mouse click) for better visualization of
     varying traffic volumes
   - Interactive tooltips showing detailed traffic information at specific points
   - Yellow highlight indicators for selected data points

4. Smooth transitions between different time ranges with animated scaling

These improvements allow users to better monitor and analyze network
traffic patterns over time, which is especially useful for debugging
connectivity issues or understanding network behavior under different
conditions.

The implementation includes proper thread-safety considerations and
handles edge cases like time jumps or missing data appropriately.

4. Smooth transitions between different time ranges with animated scaling

These improvements allow users to better monitor and analyze network
